result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • John Hirsch III was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to prison on 8-13-21; unpaid supervision fees of $479 per DOC
Filed by Attorney Peter Middleton

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by video Zoom for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant John Hirsch III appeared by video Zoom, in custody from Stanley Correctional Institution, Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared by video Zoom for John Hirsch III. Court reviews defendant's rights to be personally present, Defendant would like to appear by video Zoom, Counsel has received revocation summary, Court sentences defendant to: Ct. 1,  2 years prison, 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, 225 days sentence credit, Civil Judgment to be entered for unpaid court obligations, Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for Substances Abuse Program

Letter from defendant requesting clarification of his JOC
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant John Hirsch in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, conds: 6 mo. jail, consecutive to any other sentences serving, starting July 10, 2015 at 7 p.m. No opposition to electronic monitoring. Good time granted. May transfer to Washington Cty. Jail. Huber granted under jail rules. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. $2,452 fine. Submit DNA sample, pay $250 surcharge. $65 blood draw fee. 36 month revocation, 36 month IID upon licensure. Court granted 66 days jail credit. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed.

Defendant John Hirsch in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Riek has received offer and willing to accept.  Needs time to discuss the offer with defendant.  Atty Riek is to contact the judicial assistant for a return date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant John Hirsch in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  New return date requested by Atty Riek.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
